item.title: Home
item.dc:creator: brynrwilliams
item.content:encoded:
Pub Philosophy

Thursdays at The Hoxton Cabin Kingsland Street

Click here for tickets, times, and availability

Philosophy Cabin Is Free - but you do need to book if you wish to attend

Thursday 6:15pm -7:45pm

Join us downstairs at the Hoxton Cabin in our Thursday slot for an hour and a half of live, in the moment philosophy. Bring your questions, your creativity and your enquiring minds to dig deep into a topic that we will choose on the night.

Why Philosophy?

Philosophy is a way of thinking about general and fundamental questions, such as those about ethics, thought, time, meaning, value, existence, reason, knowledge, mind and language.
Every meeting we choose a question which only philosophy can address. From the familiar like "What is a good life?" or "How do we tell reality from illusion?" to the less familiar: "Does my dog love me?", "Is it okay to kill zombies?" The questions are decided together on the night from your suggestions. It all depends on you.


The aim is to forge a better understanding of our own natures and our world together. Its also to simply enjoy the excitement and stimulation of dancing with ideas. Philosophy for Philosophy's sake.
Dogs welcome. Free Popcorn at the Cabin.

Reviews

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: brynrwilliams
item.content:encoded:
Bryn Williams is credited (along with Rick Lewis, editor of Philosophy Now magazine) with first bringing Pub Philosophy to London in the late '90s. He has achieved the trifecta of Philosophy qualifications: BA, MPhil and PhD, the latter two from King's College London. For the last 17 years he has worked as a data analyst at a large London Acute NHS trust.

Hoxton Cabin is a bar, café & events space located in the heart of East London. If you’re looking for a night of fun and entertainment, Hoxton Cabin offers it all — a great vibe, live music, stand-up comedy, philosophy nights, exhibitions, screenings and a (short but sweet) food & beverages menu. https://www.hoxtoncabin.com/about

First Love Foundation is a Tower Hamlets based charity. They have spent the past 10 years helping thousands of people facing crisis to get their lives back on track. Any profit from the Philosophy Cabin will go to help them continue their work. https://www.firstlovefoundation.org.uk/ourmodel#

item.title: Suggest The Next Philosophy Cabin Question
item.dc:creator: brynrwilliams

item.title: English Philosophy Cafe in Geneva
item.dc:creator: brynrwilliams
item.content:encoded:
The English Philosophy Café at the Birthplace of Rousseau!

For those who speak English or are looking to improve their English, this is the perfect opportunity to explore philosophical ideas in a casual, welcoming setting. Led by Dr. Bryn Williams, our café fosters open discussions on topics decided by attendees on the day.

When: Every other Saturday, from 11:15 am to 12:45 pm, starting 21st September 2024.

Where: Maison Rousseau et Littérature, Grand Rue 40, 1204 Geneva.

Seats are limited, so please reserve your spot early to ensure participation. Please bring your own topic suggestions, and let’s dive into engaging discussions inspired by the birthplace of one of philosophy’s greatest thinkers!

Reserve your spot: Meetup event page.

Looking forward to meeting you there!

Why Philosophy?

Philosophy is a way of thinking about general and fundamental questions, such as those about ethics, thought, time, meaning, value, existence, reason, knowledge, mind and language.
Every meeting we choose a question which only philosophy can address. From the familiar like “What is a good life?” or “How do we tell reality from illusion?” to the less familiar: “Does my dog love me?”, “Is it okay to kill zombies?” The questions are decided together on the night from your suggestions. It all depends on you.


The aim is to forge a better understanding of our own natures and our world together. It's also to simply enjoy the excitement and stimulation of dancing with ideas. Philosophy for Philosophy’s sake.

English Café de la philosophie à Genève

Rejoignez-nous à La Maison Rousseau et Littérature. Apportez vos questions, votre créativité et vos esprits curieux pour creuser en profondeur un sujet que nous choisirons sur place.

Pourquoi la philosophie ?

La philosophie est une manière de réfléchir aux questions générales et fondamentales, telles que l’éthique, la pensée, le temps, le sens, la valeur, l’existence, la raison, la connaissance, l’esprit et le langage. Lors de chaque réunion, nous sélectionnons une question que seule la philosophie peut aborder. Des questions familières telles que “Qu’est-ce qu’une bonne vie ?” ou “Comment distinguer la réalité de l’illusion ?” aux interrogations moins courantes comme “Mon chien m’aime-t-il ?” ou “Est-il acceptable de tuer des zombies ?”. Les sujets sont décidés ensemble lors de la soirée, en fonction de vos suggestions. Tout dépend de vous.

L’objectif est de forger une meilleure compréhension de notre nature et de notre monde, tout en savourant l’excitation et la stimulation de la danse des idées. La philosophie pour la philosophie elle-même.
